children.subject: A person I know was deviation(s) below on the midterms/final and still managed a B-/C+ or something like that on a recent iteration of the course, so you'll probably be fine. BerkeleyTime is probably the most accurate easily accessible source for this however, and from a quick look it seems approximately 4-5% of students manage to get a failing grade. Just don't be 2 deviations below on every assignment and exam and do all the vitamins and attempt all the homework possible and you should be ok.

I feel you, I'm struggling this semester with the Java hws too and that's despite the fact that I LOVE coding. It seems hard to go from the high level lecture content to actual implementation in hws. I'm in my last semester and W186 is probably my least favorite CS upper div based on the content so far. Also, maybe similar to you, I'm fine with just passing (higher grade is preferable though).

If you want, we can be study buddies!
What kind of role/full time offer are you talking about? Not sure why a CS major would hate coding to the point where you're asking for how to get a D in a pretty straightforward class.

history.content:
Hi all:
Actually I think I am not supposed to ask this seemingly dumb question. I am having a very hard time going through csw186. As a cs major at Cal, I shamingly HATE coding. Though cs186 may be a chill course for you, I am not having a good time with this one. All I need is to get a cs degree to meet the requirement of my full time offer. So I would like to ask how hard to get a D in csw186 because I need this class to graduate. How well should I do in hw(aka projects) and with the exams.
ps: I am gonna do consulting after graduate so it will be totally unrelated to coding.
Thank you for any help!
history.subject: How  hard to get a D in CSW186
